column4: I've had a look at those pages and I am totally clueless :( I've only had ubuntu installed for about 3 hours now
did it fail when you tryed to change device like it says in the bot factoid?
sorry to ask another stupid question, but is Master and PCM both un muted and not set to 0 in the gnome volume control window that pops up when you double click the volume applet in the bar?
is your sound card listed under "Change Device" in the file menu of the volume control?
ok open the terminal and run two commands "sudo lsmod" and "sudo lspci" and then pastebin the results?
stupid question alert! how do I use pastebin? lol
you should have gotten a private message from ubotu with information
lsmod results = http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8951/    and lspci results = http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8952/
in a terminal have you run "sudo alsaconf", if not you can definitely try it, it might clear some config issues that the ubuntu installer created by accident
sudo aptitude install alsa-utils first then try "sudo alsaconf"
still says "sudo aslaconf: command not found"
did it look like the alsa-utils package installed fine?
sudo dpkg -l | grep alsa-utils that will return one line if it is installed, try "sudo /usr/sbin/alsaconf" as well

I have to run and catch a bus, really sorry, keep those urls for pastebin in case someone else wants to look at them. It does sound like your drivers are installed fine, I frankly confused that it's not working. obviously double check all volumes and headphone jacks and your speakers etc, good luck
the sudo dpkg came up with "ii  alsa-utils                                 1.0.11-6ubuntu2                      ALSA utilities"
yeah try "sudo /usr/sbin/alsaconf" then, I'll be on later tonight again"
but the sudo /usr/sbin/alsaconf can up with command not found
